translation.en: [woman 1] I want you to start with the night of August 6th, 2004.
[woman 2] I was with Kut, a pimp.
He said that I needed to get some money.
[man] This defendant shot Johnny Allen in the head, in his bed,
translation.ko: 피고인은 침대에 있는 조니 앨런의 머리를 쐈습니다

translation.en: but gives a wild theory of how it was self-defense.
translation.ko: 그런데 이것이 정당방위였다는 허황한 주장을 하고 있어요

translation.en: I shot him because I thought he was gonna shoot me.
We, the jury, find the defendant, Cyntoia Denise Brown,
translation.ko: 배심원단은 피고인인 신토이아 데니즈 브라운에 대하여

translation.en: guilty, first-degree murder.
[woman 1] If you are a juvenile and you're convicted in Tennessee of first-degree murder,
translation.ko: 미성년자가 테네시주에서 1급 살인 유죄 평결을 받으면

translation.en: the only two options are either true life without parole or 51 years.
translation.ko: 선고는 둘 중 하나예요 가석방 없는 종신형이거나 51년 형이거나요

translation.en: Hey, Mommy.
Well, I got life.
[woman 3] Outside of the glass and the bars,
we may never be like a mother and a daughter should be.
translation.ko: 다시는 평범한 엄마와 딸이 될 수 없을지도 몰라요

translation.en: Here's a kid who didn't have a chance.
She didn't have a chance before she was born...
[woman 4] I got pregnant on my 16th birthday.
I drank, and I was introduced to crack cocaine.
translation.ko: 술도 마셨고 크랙 코카인에도 손을 댔죠

translation.en: My mother, we didn't live in a very stable home.
translation.ko: 엄마와 전 안정된 가정에서 살지 못했어요

translation.en: It came from genetics, and the genetics should stop.
translation.ko: 집안 내력을 물려받은 거예요 그 내력을 끊어야죠

translation.en: Cyntoia Brown, in prison for more than a decade now,
translation.ko: 십여 년 넘게 형을 살고 있는 신토이아 브라운의 사건이

translation.en: her case is catching fire on social media.
[man 2] Cyntoia made the decision to seek the help of the governor
and petition for clemency.
[man 3] In 2004, she was considered a prostitute.
Today, she would be considered a victim of sexual predators.
translation.ko: 지금은 성 약탈자들의 피해자로 간주될 것입니다

translation.en: She has made the most amazing transformation.
[Cyntoia] I have come such a long way.
It's been a very long time.
When I was 16, I did a horrible thing,
and I have carried that with me this whole time.
I know that your decision is very serious.
translation.ko: 여러분의 결정이 매우 중요한 걸 압니다

translation.en: I do pray that you show me mercy and that you give me a second chance.
translation.ko: 제게 삶의 두 번째 기회를 주시기를 원합니다

translation.en: My name is Cyntoia Denise Brown.
I'm 16 years old.
We are in Nashville, Tennessee
at the Davidson County Juvenile Detention Center.
I was charged with homicide and robbery
translation.ko: 제가 받은 혐의는 살인 및 강도랑

translation.en: and possession of a weapon and criminal impersonation.
Most of my life, I've been feeling how everybody else wants me to feel
translation.ko: 이제껏 내 기분이 아니라 남들 기분에 휩쓸리고

translation.en: and saying what everybody else wants me to say.
That's because I was so wanting to be loved
because I really just never felt like anybody loved me.
translation.ko: 사랑받는단 생각이 든 적이 한 번도 없어서요

translation.en: I wasn't happy at home. I was stressed out all the time.
translation.ko: 집에선 늘 짜증만 나고 행복하지 않았어요

translation.en: It just kind of wears you out and tires you out, ages you, makes you grow.
translation.ko: 진이 빠져 녹초로 만들고 나이만 먹어 성숙해져요

translation.en: Old... tired, weary.
That's how I feel.
I just keep setting myself up for failure.
translation.ko: 자꾸 실패하는 길로만 빠져드는 것 같아요

translation.en: I fall every time, and each time I fall harder.
translation.ko: 넘어지면 넘어질 때마다 더 세게 부딪히는데

translation.en: And I'd say this has been my hardest fall. [laughs]
[woman] Cyntoia is charged with criminal homicide, especially aggravated robbery,
translation.ko: 신토이아의 혐의는 살인으로 거기에 특수 강도죄와

translation.en: a handgun possession, and criminal impersonation.
The most serious of those being the criminal homicide charge.
translation.ko: 그중 가장 심각한 건 살인 혐의고요

translation.en: She's charged with an offense that happened on the night of August 6th,
and she's been in here, in the Juvenile Justice Center,
since August 8th when she was arrested by police on the charge.
The state has announced an intent to attempt to transfer her
translation.ko: 검찰은 신토이아의 사건을 성인 법정으로 이송해 "캐스린 에번스 신백 변호인 메트로폴리탄 국선변호인실"

translation.en: to the adult system to treat her as any other adult charged with homicide.
translation.ko: "캐스린 에번스 신백 변호인 메트로폴리탄 국선변호인실" 살인 혐의를 받은 성인과 똑같이 재판하려는 의도를 내비쳤어요

translation.en: [Sinback] In Tennessee, juveniles can be transferred on any charge if they're 16 or older.
translation.ko: 테네시에선 16세 이상이면 어느 혐의로든 이송이 가능해요

translation.en: Cyntoia is right there on the dividing line.
We've had people in Tennessee as young as 12 years old before
translation.ko: 심지어 12살짜리 아이도 테네시에서 살인 혐의를 받아

translation.en: transferred on homicide charges.
My job is to show the judge that Cyntoia is worth saving.
translation.ko: 제 일은 신토이아가 감형받을 자격이 있음을 보여주는 겁니다

translation.en: In juvenile court, she would receive the services that she needs
translation.ko: 소년 법정에선 신토이아에게 필요한 도움들을 받을 수 있는데

translation.en: that will be identified by the doctors, I hope, after her psychological testing.
translation.ko: 심리 검사 후 그런 도움들을 받을 수 있는지 결정하게 돼요

translation.en: That's where Dr. Bernet and Dr. Walker really come in.
translation.ko: 버넷 박사님과 워커 박사님이 그 역할을 맡으셨죠

translation.en: They can identify what the problems are with Cyntoia,
translation.ko: 두 분이 신토이아에게 어떤 문제들이 있는지 파악하고

translation.en: why she's acting the way she is and whether those problems can be treated.
translation.ko: 왜 그런 식으로 행동하는지 치료는 가능한지 판단하실 거예요

translation.en: [Bernet] Cyntoia has been seen by several different psychologists
translation.ko: 신토이아는 그동안 여러 심리학자와 사람들을 만나

translation.en: and different people conducting evaluations.
She's in even more trouble than anybody really ever imagined.
translation.ko: 그 누구보다 심각한 문제를 안고 있죠 "윌리엄 버넷 박사 법정신의학자"

translation.en: Cyntoia, did somebody explain to you why I'm meeting with you today,
translation.ko: 신토이아, 우리가 오늘 왜 만나는지 알고 있니?

translation.en: why we're having this evaluation?
[Cyntoia] Because of what I did.
Yeah.
You know, the purpose of doing this evaluation,
it might be able to help you when you go to court.
I want to get straight...
who's in your family. You have sort of a complicated family.
translation.ko: 네 가족 얘길 해보자 가족사가 좀 복잡하던데

translation.en: Yeah, my mom, Ellenette Brown.
-[Bernet] What kind of work does she do? -She's a teacher.
Gina, is this your biological mother?
Yeah.
-Gina as in Gina-- -Georgina Mitchell.
-How old is she, do you think? -She's probably 32.
Yeah, do you know how to tell?
[Cyntoia] Because she had me when she was about 16. I'm 16.
translation.ko: 엄마가 16살 때 절 낳았고 제가 지금 16살이니까요

translation.en: Right. That's right.
Does that seem sort of funny to you that your mom was 16 and now you're 16?
translation.ko: 그때 엄마가 16이었고 네가 지금 16인 게 신기하지 않니?

translation.en: -Does that-- -[Cyntoia] I guess. I don't know.
-Does that seem sort of strange? -[Cyntoia] No.
[Bernet] Do you know anything about your dad?
-[Bernet] Some people have mood swings. -Mm-hmm.
[Bernet] Have you ever had that happen to you? Do you know what a mood swing is?
translation.ko: 너도 그걸 겪은 적 있니? 감정 기복이 뭔지 알아?

translation.en: -Yeah, I have them all the time. -[Bernet] Yeah.
Can you tell me about them? What happens when you have a mood swing?
translation.ko: 그 얘길 해줄래? 감정 기복이 오면 어떠니?

translation.en: [Cyntoia] One minute, I'll be happy, and then I'll be depressed and sad and gloomy.
translation.ko: 기분이 좋았다가도 한순간에 침울하고, 슬프고, 우울해져요

translation.en: And then I'll be mad, and then I'll be back happy.
And then I'll be just kind of depressed...
and different type of stuff like that.
[Bernet] These times when you get real depressed and you cry nonstop,
translation.ko: 우울한 감정이 심해서 끊임없이 울기만 할 때는

translation.en: how long does that typically last?
Does it last a day or week or two, three weeks?
Anywhere from a day to hours to weeks.
translation.ko: 온종일이나 몇 시간 또는 몇 주씩 그래요

translation.en: The longest was for like a week and a half I cried.
translation.ko: 제일 오래 운 게 일주일 반 정도였어요

translation.en: What happens when you get real happy?
That's very often-- I mean, very rare that I get just real happy.
translation.ko: 그런 경우는 매우 잦아요 아니, 매우 드물어요

translation.en: If I'm talking to someone and having a good conversation, I'll be happy.
[Bernet] What about times you get real, real angry?
When I'm locked up.
I don't like people telling me do this, do that,
you need to do it this way, not the other way,
translation.ko: 이렇게 하면 안 되고 저렇게 해야 하고 이런 식으로 굴어야지 저런 식이면 곤란하다고 하고

translation.en: and you need to be like this,
translation.ko: 이런 식으로 굴어야지 저런 식이면 곤란하다고 하고

translation.en: you shouldn't think like this. I don't like it.
translation.ko: 그런 생각 하면 안 된다고 명령하는 게 싫어요

translation.en: It fucking drives me nuts, and I can't stand it.
Well...
I got a lot of information here, and I'm gonna have to talk to Dr. Walker.
translation.ko: 많은 정보를 얻었으니 워커 박사님과 얘기하고

translation.en: And then I'm gonna talk to Kathy Evans,
and then we're going to try to do something that might help you out
translation.ko: 법정에서 너한테 도움이 될 만한 걸

translation.en: when you go to court.
Do you think you can?
Cyntoia, this first thing I'd like you to do is kind of a test of your imagination.
translation.ko: 신토이아, 먼저 네 상상력을 시험해 보려고 해

translation.en: I'm going to show you some pictures,
some cards with pictures on them.
I want you to make up a story about each picture.
translation.ko: 각 그림을 보고 이야기를 만드는 거지

translation.en: Please tell me what's happening in the picture,
translation.ko: 그림에서 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있고 왜 그런 일이 일어났으며 결말은 어떨지

translation.en: what led up to the scene and how the story ends.
translation.ko: 왜 그런 일이 일어났으며 결말은 어떨지

translation.en: Tell me what the people are talking about and what they're feeling.
translation.ko: 무슨 대화를 하고 있고 어떤 기분일지를

translation.en: Use your imagination and remember there are no right or wrong answers, okay?
translation.ko: 상상력을 발휘해 말하는데 여기에 정답은 없어, 알았지?

translation.en: -Tell me a story about this one. -Oh, shit.
I think she killed the little girl.
translation.ko: 이 여자가 어린 여자애를 죽였나 봐요

translation.en: -[Walker] Say again. -She killed the little girl
translation.ko: - 뭐라고? 이 여자가... - 여자애를 죽였나 봐요

translation.en: because I see some blood or something right here, and now she's feeling bad.
translation.ko: 여기 피 같은 게 있잖아요 그래서 속상해하네요

translation.en: She's just realizing what she's done.
Tell me a story about this one.
[Cyntoia] Well, I think they just got to arguing.
translation.ko: 여기선 두 사람이 말싸움하는 것 같아요

translation.en: And she really doesn't want him to kiss her,
but he's forcing her.
This slut is telling her to give her the money.
translation.ko: 이 쌍년이 얘한테 돈 달라고 하고 있어요

translation.en: This bitch is sitting back enjoying it. I hate people like that, swear to God.
translation.ko: 이년은 보면서 즐기고 있죠 이런 애들 진짜 싫어요

translation.en: And they're doing it because she's black.
She probably was friends with these two girls.
They just used her so they could get what they wanted out of her.
translation.ko: 근데 사실은 이 둘이 얘를 이용해 먹은 것뿐이었죠

translation.en: [Bernet] Did you talk to Dr. Walker this morning? [Sinback] I have not talked to him yet.
translation.ko: - 오전에 워커 박사랑 얘기했나요? - 아직 얘기 못 했어요

translation.en: He's drafted up some results here,
but basically, the testing is totally consistent.
translation.ko: 기본적으로 검사 결과가 완전한 일관성을 보여요

translation.en: On the testing, she was honest, and so in other words, it appeared to be valid.
translation.ko: 신토이아가 검사에 솔직히 답해 검사가 유효해 보이고요

translation.en: The Roberts Apperception Test is the one where you show
the pictures of the situations, and the person makes up stories.
translation.ko: 어떤 그림인지 이야기를 만들어보게 하는 건데

translation.en: He said it was very striking. All her stories were chaotic,
and none of them had a resolution.
They were all violence, aggression,
an unusual degree of negative emotion, anger, rejection.
translation.ko: 부정적 감정과 분노, 박탈감이 유난히 높았어요

translation.en: I mean, this is her view of the world.
How did this manifest itself when this guy Johnny was killed?
translation.ko: 이것이 조니란 사람을 죽일 때 어떻게 작용했을까요?

translation.en: See, I think that some of these characteristics affected the behaviors.
translation.ko: 전 이러한 성향들이 행동에 영향을 미쳤다고 봐요

translation.en: Her affect of instability, in other words, becoming suddenly frightened
translation.ko: 불안정한 정서로 인해 그 상황에 놓였을 때

translation.en: about the situation she was in and her paranoia.
translation.ko: 갑자기 겁을 먹고 편집증을 보인 거죠

translation.en: Now, what can we do with all this?
translation.ko: 이제 이러한 결과로 뭘 할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: She's 16-and-a-half.
She is.
So if she were to stay in the juvenile court,
she would be under the control of the juvenile court until she's 19.
translation.ko: 19살까지는 소년법원의 관리를 받을 수 있을 거고

translation.en: I think that would be long enough to help her get her situation under control.
translation.ko: 그 정도면 신토이아가 자신을 추스르게 도울 수 있겠어요

translation.en: She has a serious personality disorder which requires therapy
translation.ko: 신토이아는 심각한 성격장애를 갖고 있고 치료가 필요해요

translation.en: in a good, wholesome residential program.
Tomorrow, we're gonna be going to court,
but today, we're gonna have an opportunity to talk with her biological mother.
translation.ko: "밴더빌트 대학교 정신병원 테네시주 내슈빌" 오늘은 신토이아의 친모와 얘기하는 기회를 가질 거예요

translation.en: So that's kind of-- That's a little bit unusual.
Cyntoia was given up for adoption about 14 years ago,
and her biological mother had not seen her in all that time.
It would be helpful to know whether there's any kind of mental disorder
translation.ko: 신토이아의 친가족 사이에 정신장애 병력은 없는지

translation.en: among the biological family of Cyntoia.
It's really good to see you before the hearing
because there are a few things that I wanted to find out or ask both of you about.
translation.ko: 두 분께 묻고 알아보고 싶은 게 몇 가지 있거든요

translation.en: And I guess I'm kind of glad that you all could say hi to each other.
translation.ko: 두 분이 서로 만나게 돼서 그것도 기쁘네요

translation.en: I guess you haven't really seen each other for a long time.
It's been a long time. Yes, it has.
-[Burnet] Yeah. -Fourteen-and-a-half years.
Ms. Mitchell, I'll tell you what I would find helpful
translation.ko: 미첼 씨, 어제 신토이아를 만나서 어땠는지 말씀해 주시면

translation.en: is how things went yesterday when you saw Cyntoia. How'd that go?
I was real excited and real happy. And I had been waiting a long time.
translation.ko: 오래 기다린 만남이라 무척 기대됐고 행복했어요 "조지나 미첼 신토이아 브라운의 친모"

translation.en: And I was just so glad to see her.
I know Ellenette has provided for her, and I thank her for that.
translation.ko: 엘러넷이 잘 키워줘서 그게 너무 고맙죠 "엘러넷 브라운 신토이아 브라운의 양모"

translation.en: I’m glad you met. Was it like-- How long did y'all--
[Mitchell] Oh, for a long time.
Um, I could see, you know, the traits she has.
translation.ko: 그 애가 가진 기질이 눈에 보이더라고요

translation.en: It was like looking at me at that same age.
translation.ko: 그 나이 때 저를 보는 듯한 느낌이었어요

translation.en: The ups and downs, anger one minute, happy the next.
translation.ko: 감정 기복이 심했죠 불쑥 화냈다 금세 풀어졌어요

translation.en: You know, she wanted to know about our side of the family and...
Let me just ask you about some family history stuff
because, you know, sometimes, when people have some sort of mental problem,
translation.ko: 왜냐면 정신적 문제를 겪는 사람들 중에는

translation.en: sometimes it runs in families because of genetic things.
translation.ko: 유전 때문에 가족력을 물려받는 사람도 있거든요

translation.en: [Mitchell] My mom shot herself. She sent me next door
translation.ko: 엄마 스스로 총을 쐈어요 절 옆집으로 보내놓고요

translation.en: when I was in second grade,
and she shot herself in the stomach.
translation.ko: 엄마가 자기 배에 대고 총을 쏘셨죠

translation.en: My mom and her mom, both of them, they're drunks, suicidal.
translation.ko: 저희 엄마와 외할머니 둘 다 술꾼에 자살 성향이 있었어요

translation.en: She took a shotgun and blowed her chest away, killed herself.
translation.ko: 엄마는 산탄총을 꺼내 들고 자기 상체를 날려버렸죠

translation.en: Your mom had a biological brother
who had some problems as well, mental health problems?
I know about these, yeah. Um, all of them do.
translation.ko: 그 얘긴 저도 아는데 형제가 다 그랬대요

translation.en: And see, that's why I left, because...
I prayed to God that--
I didn't wanna be like her. I didn't wanna be like none of 'em.
translation.ko: 전 엄마처럼 되기 싫고 가족들처럼 되기 싫다고요

translation.en: [Burnet] Right.
Can you tell me what she was like then? What kind of baby was she?
translation.ko: 신토이아가 어릴 땐 어땠나요? 어떤 아이였어요?

translation.en: [Mitchell] Oh, she was a good baby.
She was real good.
It just got really hard, and I felt like I just... You know, I couldn't do it alone.
translation.ko: 그런데 삶이 팍팍해졌고 혼자 감당하기엔 벅찼어요

translation.en: -Eighteen months. -We had her off and on
since she was six months old.
[Burnet] What happened after that? I guess when she got in high school,
translation.ko: 그 후엔 어떻게 됐죠? 고등학교 때부터 심각해졌나요?

translation.en: -or junior high, there were more serious-- -[Brown] Well, yes.

And she was gone for, I think, maybe a few days.
And she had someone to call me.
[Brown] I said, "Well, you know, that only lasts for a little while,
translation.ko: 전화에 대고 말했죠 '너 지금 이러는 거 다 한때야'

There's no way in the world you could take care of yourself."
So, of course she agreed, you know, and she came home.
translation.ko: 그 말에 아이가 수긍하고 집으로 돌아왔어요

translation.en: And then from that point on, it was just like every day,
translation.ko: 그런데 그 일을 시작으로 거의 매일같이

translation.en: every other day, every month, every other month,

translation.en: it was just something, just something constantly. Constantly.
-Meaning more and more behavior problems? -[Brown] More and more.
It's like the behavior problems,

translation.en: [Brown] I think Cyntoia had just pretty well, at that point, made up her mind.

I'm past it, you know. I mean...
-[Sinback] I'm very proud of you guys. -My past is my past, you know, and...
translation.ko: - 두 분께 정말 감사해요 - 과거는 과거니까요

translation.en: -[Sinback] Mm-hmm. -You know, I've moved on, you know, and...

translation.en: [Burnet] The issue in juvenile court is whether Cyntoia should remain in juvenile court

translation.en: or whether she should be transferred to criminal court.

It's going to be an uphill battle.
Not only do I have to show

translation.en: [Green] All right.
We are here this afternoon, I believe, in the matter of Cyntoia Brown.

translation.en: -[Sinback] Yes, Your Honor. -[Brown] So are we ready to proceed?
-[man] Yes, ma'am. -[Sinback] Yes, ma'am.
-[Green] You are Cyntoia Brown? -[Cyntoia] Yes, ma'am.

translation.ko: 네, 지금 그때를 생각하면 포주라고 생각해요

translation.ko: '인타운 스위트'의 모텔 방에서 컷과 뭘 하고 있었나요?

translation.ko: 약에 취하거나 섹스했죠 하는 거라곤 그게 다였으니까

translation.en: [Sinback] What did he say to you that evening?

translation.ko: 잠깐 자도 되냐고 물었죠 한동안 잘 못 잤다고요

translation.ko: 그날 밤 특별히 긴장한 이유가 있나요? 그 사람 행동 때문에요

translation.en: in between my legs, like, he just grabbed it real hard.

Like that, and I turned over real hard.
translation.ko: 이렇게 뿌리치곤 그 사람을 등지고 누웠죠

translation.en: [Sinback] What did you do at that time?

[man] Mr. Allen was asleep and facing away from you
translation.ko: 앨런 씨가 등을 돌려 자는데 피고인이 쏜 거죠?

translation.ko: 앨런 씨가 등을 돌려 자는데 피고인이 쏜 거죠? 아니에요

[man] You don't want to do this. You don't want to be here.

And your belief in that is based on the fact
translation.ko: 그렇게 생각한 근거는 그 사람한테 총이 있고 저격수였다고 말한 데 있어요

translation.en: that he told you he had some guns and he's a sharpshooter.
translation.ko: 그 사람한테 총이 있고 저격수였다고 말한 데 있어요

translation.en: [Cyntoia] Not only that but the way he was acting.

translation.en: [Burks] Well, all I know about his activities is what you've told us,
translation.ko: 그의 행동이 어땠는지는 피고인의 말로만 알 수 있고

translation.en: and that's really all we'll ever know...
-[Cyntoia] Right. -[Burks] ...since you killed him.

translation.ko: 그 집을 나오려고 하면 그가 해칠 것 같았다고 했지만

translation.en: but you felt comfortable not only getting in the car and going home with him,
translation.ko: 흔쾌히 그의 차에 올라 그 집에 갔을 뿐만 아니라

translation.en: -but getting into bed with him. -The reason that I was acting asleep
translation.ko: - 침대에도 같이 누웠어요 - 제가 자는 척한 건

translation.ko: 그 사람도 잠들어서 몰래 나오려던 거예요

translation.en: [Burks] Or... or, Ms. Brown, was it that so he would go to sleep
translation.ko: 아니면 이건 아닐까요? 그 사람이 잠든 사이에

translation.ko: 그를 쏘고 그 집의 물건을 몽땅 갖고 나오려던 거요

translation.ko: 왜 이유도 없이 누굴 쏴요? 말이 안 되잖아요

translation.en: [Burks] Well, why did you shoot him?
I shot him because I thought he was gonna shoot me.
It would be a shock to me if I get transferred.
With everything that was said last night,
translation.ko: 어제 한 모든 얘길 봤을 때

translation.en: I can't see how that didn't touch the judge.
translation.ko: 판사님 마음에 와닿지 않았을 리 없어요

translation.en: And how that couldn't wave her opinion to think,
"Okay, if I have the power to change this child's life,
translation.ko: '내게 이 아이의 인생을 바꿀 힘이 있다면'

translation.en: I'm not gonna throw it away."
Hopefully, she's thinking along those lines.
I can't see why she wouldn't be.
You know, we'll never know what actually happened in Cyntoia's case.
translation.ko: 신토이아 사건의 실상은 알아낼 도리가 없어요

translation.en: You got paranoid that he was gonna do this, and so you shot him.
translation.ko: 물론 자신을 해칠까 두려워 피해자를 쐈다고는 해도

translation.en: But then you go and take his wallet, his truck,
translation.ko: 그러고는 그 사람의 지갑과 트럭을 취한 것은

translation.en: and that casts big-time doubt on your motives there.
translation.ko: 피고인의 동기가 뭔지 충분히 의심할 만하게 하죠

translation.en: Those are her facts. I don't necessarily agree with those facts.
translation.ko: 전 피고인이 말하는 사실에는 그다지 동의하지 않아요

translation.en: [Cyntoia] You remember the transfer hearing?
Jeff Burks, you know the hostility between us?
He cross-examined me.
And he was questioning me like I was before the jury, was he not?
translation.ko: 배심원단이 있는 것처럼 절 신문했잖아요, 안 그래요?

translation.en: Adversarial proceeding, that's what it's not supposed to be,
translation.ko: 당사자주의의 절차가 적용돼선 안 되는 심리에

translation.en: and that's what it was.
It was a fucking trial, and the same issue was,
was it premeditated or self-defense? That was the whole issue, wasn't it?
That's the issue at this fucking trial.
This is my diary.
I just write little things.
I'm on my seventh page, telling my lawyers everything about me,
what started from day one,
so they can know... get a feel of me to work my case better.
translation.ko: 저를 아시면 변호 준비에 도움이 될까 해서 시작했어요

translation.en: I know they care for me, and they want the best for me.
translation.ko: 절 위해주고 제가 잘되길 바라시는 거 알아요

translation.en: 'Cause I'm really expecting to go home or hoping to go home.
translation.ko: 집에 가길 기대하거든요 집에 가길 바라요

translation.en: My biggest challenge for now is gonna be to keep from going crazy.
translation.ko: 지금 제게 가장 힘든 건 미치지 않게 버티는 거예요

translation.en: I'm not a murderer. I didn't viciously murder that man.
translation.ko: 전 살인마가 아니고 무참히 죽이지 않았어요

translation.en: Why do y'all say that about me?
[Bernet] Her new attorney is Wendy Tucker.
And a couple months ago, Ms. Tucker sent me a message
translation.ko: 몇 달 전에 터커 변호인이 제게 메시지를 보내

translation.en: asking me to continue with this evaluation.
translation.ko: 심리 평가를 계속해 주길 부탁했죠 "밴더빌트 정신병원"

translation.en: And so now the questions are somewhat different
translation.ko: 이제 신토이아가 형사 공판에 나갈 거라

translation.en: because she's gonna go to a criminal trial.
Cyntoia is charged with first-degree murder.
If the defense can show that she did not premeditate,
translation.ko: 피고 측 변호인단이 모살이 아님을 증명한다면

translation.en: then the jury would say she does not meet the criteria for first-degree murder.
translation.ko: 배심원단은 이 사건이 1급 살인은 아니라고 할 겁니다

translation.en: The definition depends on the mental state of the person who's committing the act.
translation.ko: 그 정의는 살인을 저지른 사람의 정신 상태에 달렸죠

translation.en: So let's talk about
-the waiver of Miranda rights. -[Tucker] Okay.
translation.ko: 미란다 권리의 포기에 대해 얘기해 보죠

translation.en: [Bernet] Now, my understanding of kind of the legal threshold is
translation.ko: 제가 아는 법률 지식 선에서는 본인이 권리 포기임을 인식하고

translation.en: that the phraseology has to be done in a knowing, intelligent
translation.ko: 제가 아는 법률 지식 선에서는 본인이 권리 포기임을 인식하고 "웬디 터커, 신토이아 브라운의 형사 소송 변호인" 현명하고 자발적으로 해야 하거든요

translation.en: -and voluntary manner. -Right.
Did she knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily
translation.ko: 신토이아가 충분히 알고 현명하게 자발적으로 "리처드 맥기, 신토이아 브라운의 형사 소송 변호인"

translation.en: waive her right to remain silent?
translation.ko: "리처드 맥기, 신토이아 브라운의 형사 소송 변호인" 묵비권을 포기했나요?

translation.en: [Bernet] I don't think it was knowing.
You know the whole thing about when you make a statement
that they read you your rights and stuff like that?
I know when they arrest you. -I've seen it on Cops. -Right.
They did it to me, but I didn't know it meant that you can be quiet.
translation.ko: 저한테도 말해줬는데 말 안 해도 되는지 몰랐어요

translation.en: Right. That's--
"You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can be held against you."
translation.ko: '묵비권을 행사할 수 있고 발언이 불리하게 적용될 수 있다'

translation.en: And all that, but I don't... [Bernet] That's what we'll talk about right now.
translation.ko: - 뭐 그런 건데 잘은... - 바로 그 얘길 할 거야

translation.en: Says here, "You have the right to remain silent."
Do you understand that right?
-Yes or no? -Mm-hmm.
[Bernet] "Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law."
translation.ko: '당신이 한 발언은 재판에서 불리하게 적용될 수 있다'

translation.en: So tell me in your own words what that means.
translation.ko: 이게 무슨 의미인지 네가 한번 말해봐

translation.en: Whatever you say, it'll go to court.
translation.ko: 무슨 말을 하든 법정으로 갈 거라고요

translation.en: Man, I wish I'd have paid attention to this stuff.
translation.ko: 그때 여기에 집중 좀 할걸 그랬어요

translation.en: Do you wish to waive that right and answer questions now?
-Say yes or no. -Yeah.
[Bernet] "You are entitled to consult with an attorney before interrogation
translation.ko: '질문을 받기 전에 변호사와 상의할 수 있으며'

translation.en: and to have an attorney present at the time of the interrogation."
translation.ko: '질문을 받을 때 변호사를 동반할 수 있습니다'

translation.en: -Tell me in your words what that means. -You can have a lawyer there with you.
translation.ko: - 무슨 뜻인지 말해봐 - 변호사랑 있어도 된다고요

translation.en: [Bernet] Does it tell you a certain time when you can have a lawyer?
translation.ko: 언제 변호사와 있어도 되는지 명시되어 있니?

translation.en: When they start asking questions.
[Bernet] "If you cannot afford an attorney, one will be appointed for you."
translation.ko: '변호사를 선임할 수 없다면 국선변호사가 선임될 것입니다'

translation.en: If you're broke, then you can get a free lawyer.
Does this mean you're not gonna promise me anything as far as helping me if I talk?
translation.ko: 제가 말해도 절 도와준다고 약속 못 한단 건가요?

translation.en: But you just promised me that.
Right.
And that's saying that no one has promised me that, but you have.
translation.ko: 아무도 약속할 수 없는 걸 두 분이 약속했다는 거네요

translation.en: Well, I'm sure that we're gonna... we'll do everything we can to help you.
translation.ko: 물론 우린 백방으로 널 도와주려고 할 거야

translation.en: If we can, you know... anything we can to help you, we will.
translation.ko: 널 도울 방법이 있다면 뭐든지 할 거다

translation.en: Tell me how this... how all these questions I was asking,
how do they fit into your situation?
[stammers] I don't know.
See, right now, I see it, and I understand them.
But then I didn't understand.
translation.ko: 그땐 이해 못 했어요 약에 취해 피곤했거든요

translation.en: -I was high, and I was tired. -Tell me about these--
translation.ko: 그땐 이해 못 했어요 약에 취해 피곤했거든요 그때 얘길...

translation.en: [Cyntoia] Plus, they said that, if I told them, they could give me a deal.
translation.ko: 게다가 제가 말하면 거래를 제안하겠다고 했어요

translation.en: [Bernet] What was he talking about? What kind of deal?
About time, and then he said,
"No, I promised that I would talk to the DA for you."
But that wasn't the same thing he said.
He said, "I promise you that, if you talk to us, cooperate with us,
translation.ko: 제가 협조해 질문에 답하면 거래를 해주겠다고 약속했고

translation.en: we can get you a deal." I said, "Do you promise?" And he said yes.
[Bernet] What does it mean when he says, "I'll talk to the DA"?
I don't know. I'll talk to him about you--
[Bernet] He might talk to him every day about the weather or the football game.
translation.ko: 날씨나 풋볼 경기 얘기를 매일 나눌 수도 있잖아

translation.en: Yeah, but he meant that he'd talk to him about getting me a deal.
translation.ko: 그런데 저한테는 검사랑 거래를 해준다는 말이었죠

translation.en: [Bernet] But what... what would the deal be? What kind of deal?
translation.ko: 하지만 그 거래가 뭘 말하는 거였을까?

translation.en: Like less time to serve.
Because if I didn't, he said nine times out of ten I was gonna do life.
translation.ko: 제가 말 안 하면 십중팔구 종신형일 거랬어요

translation.en: [Bernet] So, did he say--
And they screwed me because I might be doing life anyways.
translation.ko: 어차피 종신형 받을지도 모르니 절 엿 먹인 거죠

translation.en: [Bernet] They told her that they were gonna go to bat for her and--
Let me stop you right there because that's real important.
translation.ko: 아주 중요한 거라 그걸 짚고 넘어갈게요

translation.en: Because when I watch the tape,
it proves that she's telling the truth.
[Bernet] There's some discussion in the very beginning.
-Something happened. -[Tucker] "You did promise me something."
Right, that comment by her, as soon as I heard it, I said, "Damn!"
translation.ko: 신토이아의 그 말을 듣는 순간 큰일 났다 싶었어요

translation.en: [Bernet] Then they said, "Well, we didn't promise you anything.
We simply said that we would talk to the DA."
-They acknowledged that they-- -[Bernet] Would talk to the--
In their view, they would say that we would talk to the DA,
but in her view, they said, "We will talk to the DA and get you a better deal."
translation.ko: 신토이아 입장에선 검사랑 유리한 거래를 해준다고 들렸죠

translation.en: She did really poorly on...
her belief that the right thing to do, the correct thing to do
translation.ko: 그 상황에서 자기가 해야 할 바르고 옳은 일은

translation.en: is to tell the police everything you know.
translation.ko: 경찰에 아는 대로 다 말하는 거라고 믿은 거예요

translation.en: -When you take the results of the test... -Mm-hmm.
-...and add to it the promise implicitly-- -[Bernet] Right. Right.
Then she's doubly mistaken.
She comes into the room with this kind of false belief
that you're better off if you talk to the police, and on top of that...
translation.ko: 경찰에 말하는 게 낫겠다고 생각한 데다

translation.en: they mislead her.
I think it's a double-- I think they combine.
It's two very large men interrogating her too, by the way.
translation.ko: 신토이아를 취조하는 경관이 거구의 두 남성이고요

translation.en: -[Bernet] Yeah. -[chuckles]
[Cyntoia] "When it comes to the charge of first-degree murder,
we, the jury, find Cyntoia Brown guilty.
When it comes to the charge of felony murder...
we, the jury, find Cyntoia Brown guilty.
When it comes to the charge of especially aggravated robbery,
we, the jury, find Cyntoia Brown guilty."
Those are the words I fear most, more than anything else in life.
translation.ko: 인생에서 다른 무엇보다 이 말들이 가장 두려워요

translation.en: I really fantasize about getting out a lot.
I think that takes a lot of my time, daydreaming,
translation.ko: 거의 하루를 그 상상을 하며 보내요

translation.en: and I know I really shouldn't be doing that
so I won't get upset if that doesn't happen.
translation.ko: 그렇게 되지 않을 경우 너무 속상하지 않게요

translation.en: But I just can't help it.
I think the 16-year-old Cyntoia was more reckless.
She'd say anything, do anything, just wild.
translation.ko: 무슨 말이든, 무슨 행동이든 냅다 지르고 봤죠

translation.en: I don't think that I'm an adult yet.
I wouldn't even say a young adult. I'd say I'm coming into adulthood.
translation.ko: 아직 청년도 아니고 성인으로 접어든다고 생각해요

translation.en: But the 18-year-old Cyntoia, she really-- She really thinks-- She understands now
that what people think of you and your impression on other people
translation.ko: 저에 대한 다른 사람들의 생각과 인상이

translation.en: is very important in life sometimes.
Maybe some other 18-year-olds can handle being at a murder trial
translation.ko: 다른 18살짜리 애들은 살인 재판을 견딜지도 모르죠

translation.en: and not getting upset when people sit up here
and throw bogus lies about you, but I can't. It's hard for me.
translation.ko: 차분히 앉아있을지 몰라도 전 아니에요, 너무 힘들어요

translation.en: I think I'll feel more fear and anxiety when I get upstairs
translation.ko: 위층으로 올라가면 더 무섭고 불안할 것 같아요

translation.en: and put on the clothes and get in the actual courtroom
when I see the jury.
It's hard for me to look at them 'cause I don't know,
translation.ko: 배심원을 못 볼 것 같아요 모르겠어요

translation.en: should I look at them? Should I not look at them?
You gotta think about how you look and make sure you're not doing nothing.
translation.ko: 제가 어떻게 보일지 신경 쓰고 아무것도 하지 말아야죠

translation.en: And you got to make sure you don't make no faces or nothing.
translation.ko: 이상한 표정 같은 것도 지어선 안 되고

translation.en: And you got to really control yourself. That's kind of hard for an 18-year-old.
translation.ko: 자신을 잘 다스려야 하는데 18살짜리에겐 힘든 일이에요

translation.en: [man] We need to add probably self-defense in the jury instruction.
translation.ko: 배심원 안내 사항에 정당방위 내용도 넣어요

translation.en: Some of that's gonna come out.
[bailiff] All rise.
His Honor, J. Randall Wyatt...
translation.ko: "J 랜들 와이엇 주니어 판사 데이비드슨 카운티 형사법원"

translation.en: [Burks] Johnny Allen...
was a realty agent in the Antioch-South Nashville area.
This defendant, Cyntoia Brown, shot Johnny Allen in the head,
translation.ko: 피고인 신토이아 브라운은 조니 앨런의 머리를 쐈습니다

translation.en: in his bed, in his home,
but gives a wild theory of how it was self-defense.
translation.ko: 그런데 이것이 정당방위였다는 허황한 주장을 하고 있어요

translation.en: At the end of the day, you will hear the medical examiner describe
translation.ko: 이따가 법의관이 나와 시신이 발견됐을 때

translation.en: how Johnny Allen's hands were in this manner here when he was found.
translation.ko: 어떻게 조니 앨런의 손이 이런 상태였는지 설명할 겁니다

translation.en: We'll ask the medical examiner what that means in this case.
translation.ko: 또한 그것이 어떤 의미인지 묻고자 합니다

translation.en: We submit that, at the end of the proof, you will hear that Cyntoia Brown...
translation.ko: 검찰은 범죄 입증 후 신토이아 브라운이 조니 앨런을

translation.en: cruelly and mercilessly executed Johnny Allen.
We'll ask that you convict her at the end of the proof. Thank you.
translation.ko: 범죄 입증 후 유죄를 평결해 주시기 바랍니다

translation.en: Now, ladies and gentlemen, you will learn
that Cyntoia Brown certainly had her issues.
translation.ko: 신토이아 브라운이 문제를 겪었음을 알게 되실 겁니다

translation.en: She was a 16-year-old runaway.
She was living on the streets
with her 24-year-old boyfriend, Garion McGlothen.
You will learn that his nickname on the streets was Kut-Throat.
And you will learn that that was a very appropriate name for him.
translation.ko: 그게 얼마나 적절한 별명인지 곧 알게 되실 겁니다

translation.en: Since running away, Cyntoia Brown had been beaten... pimped... and raped.
translation.ko: 가출한 뒤 신토이아 브라운은 폭행, 매춘, 강간을 당했습니다

translation.en: And when she felt that Johnny Allen moved,
she was sure that he was gonna get a gun, rape her, kill her, something.
translation.ko: 신토이아는 그가 총을 꺼내 자길 강간하거나 죽일 줄 알았고

translation.en: She was sure that she had to react, and she made a split-second decision
translation.ko: 대응해야 한다고 확신하고는 그 찰나의 순간에

translation.en: to choose between safety and Johnny Allen's dark side,
and she chose safety.
At the close of all the evidence, Mr. McGee will stand in front of you,
translation.ko: 모든 증거를 제시한 후 맥기 변호인이 여러분께

translation.en: and he will request that you return
the only just verdict possible in this case.
And that is a verdict of not guilty on all charges for Cyntoia Brown.
translation.ko: 바로 신토이아 브라운의 모든 혐의에 대한 무죄 평결이죠

translation.en: Thank you.
Detective Robinson, let's go back in time. August the 8th, 2004,
translation.ko: "찰스 로빈슨 형사 내슈빌 경찰서 강력계" 로빈슨 형사님, 시간을 되돌려 2004년 8월 8일

translation.en: 3:28 in the morning.
Because it was in the interview room at the police department across the street
that you and Detective Baltimore questioned Cyntoia Brown.
translation.ko: 본인과 볼티모어 형사가 신토이아 브라운을 신문했죠

translation.en: [Robinson] Yes.
[McGee] Before the tape got turned on in this case,
you spoke to Cyntoia Brown off-camera, didn't you, sir?
translation.ko: 카메라가 꺼진 상태에서 신토이아 브라운과 얘길 하셨죠?

translation.en: Very briefly. Whatever I said to Ms. Brown was very brief.
translation.ko: 아주 짧게요 제가 뭐라고 했든 간략했습니다

translation.en: "We're gonna go back here in this room. We're gonna talk,"
translation.ko: 이 방으로 다시 들어가 얘길 할 거라고요

translation.en: and it wasn't long at all.
[McGee] We see on the tape, and we heard on the tape the process beginning.
translation.ko: 영상을 보고 얘길 들어보면 취조가 시작됐고

translation.en: When you got to that portion of the form, detective,
where you read no promises or threats have been made,
Ms. Brown interrupted you. We saw it on the tape.
translation.ko: 영상에서 보면 그때 브라운 씨가 끼어들었어요

translation.en: -Didn't she? -She did.
[McGee] She said, "Promises of what?"
-Remember saying that, detective? -[Robinson] I recall telling her
translation.ko: - 혹시 기억... - 제가 말한 기억이 있어요

translation.en: that we will let the district attorney know that she cooperated with us
translation.ko: 우리한테 잘 협조하고 사건에 대해 진술했다고

translation.en: and gave us a statement and indicated
they usually take that into consideration.
We're talking about lying.
That is a technique that you have been trained to use.
translation.ko: 취조 시 적용하라고 배운 하나의 기술입니다

translation.en: -Right? -[Robinson] Exaggeration, yes.
My name is Dr. Amy R. McMaster.
I'm the Deputy Chief Medical Examiner for Davidson County,
and my official duties are to investigate
translation.ko: 제 공식적인 임무는 "리사 A 네일러, 테네시주 검사"

translation.en: causes of sudden, unnatural or unexpected death.
translation.ko: 갑작스럽거나 비정상적인 죽음의 원인을 조사하는 것입니다

translation.en: [Naylor] How would you describe his injury
as to whether he would be able to survive if for any period of time?
No, with this wound, Mr. Allen--
This would've been an immediately fatal wound.
[Naylor] His hands are clasped in the photographs. Do you see that?
translation.ko: 사진에 보시면 두 손을 모으고 있는데요, 보이십니까?

translation.en: [McMaster] Yes, I do.
[Naylor] Do you have an opinion as to whether his hands were clasped at the time of his death?
translation.ko: 두 손을 사망 시에 모았을 가능성이 있다고 보십니까?

translation.en: when this incident happened to me.
You have to pack it back, and you have to hide it so you can go on living.
translation.ko: 그 짐을 도로 싸서 숨겨야 계속 살아갈 수 있어요

translation.en: When you go through therapy, you have to close doors
translation.ko: 심리 치료를 받으러 가면 문들을 닫고 열고

translation.en: and open doors and close doors.
These doors are never, never closed.
You never go on and say, "Oh, I'm all right. Life is very happy."
translation.ko: '난 괜찮아, 삶이 행복해'라고 절대 말 못 해요

translation.en: No.
You carry it from then on.
And I don't know if there's enough love or enough support that will ever...
help Gina or Toia or many other girls.
translation.ko: 지나나 토이아나 다른 많은 여자애들을 돕진 못할 거예요

translation.en: I don't think there's any hope of either three of us turning back...
translation.ko: 우리 셋 중 누구도 과거를 극복할 희망은 없을 거예요

translation.en: from the pain of what we've gone through.
It's just something we're gonna have to live through one way or the other.
translation.ko: 그건 우리가 어떤 방식으로든 안고 살아가야 하는 것이죠

translation.en: [Mitchell] If my mama would have been that role model...
there would be no Cyntoia Brown story.
I wouldn't be sitting here talking to y'all.
Childhood abuse... molestation.
That's where a lot of hate for my mom formed around.
translation.ko: 거기서 제가 제 엄마를 혐오하게 된 거예요

translation.en: His name was Walter.
He was a relative of the neighbor.
He molested me from the time I was maybe six or seven up until I was ten.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 제가 6, 7살부터 10살 때까지 절 성추행했어요

translation.en: And the places he took me was no different from here.
translation.ko: 절 데리고 간 곳들이 여기와 다르지 않았어요

translation.en: I mean, there were woods.
If we didn't go to the woods in his truck...
translation.ko: 그 사람 트럭을 타고 숲으로 안 가면

translation.en: we were at his house.
I would just lay there frozen and relieved when it was over with.
translation.ko: 전 꼼짝 못 하고 누워있다가 다 끝나면 풀려났어요

translation.en: Then he would give me $20 and take me home.
That's sex trafficking at its finest.
I mean, when your own mother sends you out to be molested by a man
translation.ko: 엄마가 자기 딸을 남자한테 추행당하라고 보냈으니까요

translation.en: after you've repeatedly... and begged her not--
"I don't want to go. I don't want to go."
"You don't believe me? Do you hate me that much?
Do you hate me that much that you allow somebody to do this?"
translation.ko: '그렇게 미워서 다른 사람이 그런 짓을 하게 두는 거예요?'

translation.en: You know, when you go through sexual abuse as a child,
you go from being scared,
you build hate.
It's sad.
No child should have to go through that.
No woman should have to go through that. No man should have to go through that.
translation.ko: 어느 여자도, 어느 남자도 겪어선 안 될 일이에요

translation.en: Is it fair?
It's not fair at all.
But that's the world that we live in.
[Cyntoia, over phone] I think more about how my actions and my behaviors affect other people.
translation.ko: 제 행위와 행동이 타인에게 어떤 영향을 주는지 더 생각해요

translation.en: I think the fact that I realized that
is probably one of the biggest changes between me at 28 and me at 16.
translation.ko: 28살의 제가 16살의 저보다 가장 많이 변한 점이겠죠

translation.en: I care more about how what I do affects other people.
translation.ko: 다른 사람에게 피해가 가지 않을까 더 신경 써요

translation.en: I don't really deal with a lot of people in here
translation.ko: 여기서 다른 사람 일에 참견하는 사람들과는

translation.en: who are doing stuff they have no business doing.
Not only because that's just not who I want to be,
but it's not the kind of stuff I want in my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶에 그런 걸 원치 않아서요

translation.en: I go to college. I go to Lipscomb.
translation.ko: 지금은 대학에 다녀요 립스컴에서 학위도 받았지만 그보다 더 큰 의미가 있죠

translation.en: I've got a degree from Lipscomb, but it's more than that.
translation.ko: 립스컴에서 학위도 받았지만 그보다 더 큰 의미가 있죠

translation.en: It's about maintaining positive, healthy relationships
translation.ko: 긍정적이고 건전한 사람들과 긍정적이고 건전한 관계를

translation.en: with positive, healthy people.
Life in prison, it's not a life.
You have to kind of fight to carve out a life for yourself
translation.ko: 스스로 삶을 얻어내기 위해 싸워야만 하죠

translation.en: that has some kind of meaning, that has some kind of worth and some kind of value.
translation.ko: 뭔가 의미와 가치 의의가 있는 삶을 살려면요

translation.en: I think that that's really at the heart of rehabilitation
when you have been forced to grow up in prison.
And I think that is really what was... what was going on with me
and what was behind my change.
I don't want a life in prison. I want to have a life.
translation.ko: 감옥에서의 삶이 아니라 제 삶을 살고 싶어요

translation.en: Today, in 2017, Cyntoia Brown would be classified a sex slave,
translation.ko: "미성년자는 매춘부로 기소되어 선고받을 수 없다는 것이다" 2017년 오늘이라면 신토이아 브라운은 성 노예로

translation.en: a little child manipulated who didn't stand a chance
translation.ko: 자신을 이용한 남성에게 저항 한 번 해보지 못한

translation.en: against the men who used her,
but that wasn't the case in 2004.
Filmmaker Dan Birman shared video from his seven years
translation.ko: 댄 버먼 제작자가 신토이아 브라운의 사건을 담은

translation.en: documenting Cyntoia Brown's case.
[Cyntoia, over phone] I want a second chance.
Cyntoia Brown. She's been in prison for more than a decade now,
translation.ko: 십여 년 넘게 형을 살고 있는 신토이아 브라운의 사건이

translation.en: but her case is catching fire on social media, #FreeCyntoiaBrown,
after being shared on Instagram by pop superstar Rihanna.
translation.ko: 팝 스타 리아나가 인스타그램에 이를 공유한 것이죠

translation.en: [Case] Now celebrities like Rihanna, T.I. and Lana Del Rey
translation.ko: 이제 리아나, 티아이 라나 델 레이와 같은 유명인이

translation.en: are tweeting for clemency for Cyntoia,
translation.ko: 신토이아의 사면을 바라는 트윗을 남기고 있습니다

translation.en: a sex-trafficked teen doing life in prison.
[Bone] #FreeCyntoiaBrown became such an amazing experience.
I guess there were a million tweets.
The attention that Cyntoia's case has received
is an important worldwide event...
that provides an avenue for consideration of children
across the world, not just in the United States,
not just in Tennessee.
Cyntoia made the decision that the timing was appropriate
to seek the help of the governor because we knew
the governor was going into his last year in office.
translation.ko: 주지사가 임기 마지막 해에 들어섰기 때문이죠

translation.en: Governor Haslam will have served eight years
in January of 2019.
Once all of your state appeals are over, you then have a final opportunity,
translation.ko: 주 항소가 모두 기각되면 마지막 한 번의 기회가

translation.en: I guess you'd say in criminal law, to be heard.
We filed the petition for clemency
with the Board of Parole and with the governor.
They don't do a lot of hearings on clemency.
translation.ko: 사면에 있어선 심리를 많이 하지 않아요

translation.en: This was filed on behalf of Cyntoia on December the 19th, 2017.
It starts interestingly with a letter from Cyntoia to the governor,
translation.ko: 신토이아가 주지사에게 보내는 편지로 흥미롭게 시작해요

translation.en: why she thinks it's so appropriate for her to be honored with clemency from him.
translation.ko: 왜 자신이 주지사로부터 사면을 받기에 적당한지를 썼죠

translation.en: And then what we do is go through her legal and procedural backgrounds.
translation.ko: 그다음엔 신토이아의 법적, 절차적 배경을 넣었어요

translation.en: It starts, as a matter of fact,
with the letter from the president of Lipscomb University, Randy Lowry,
translation.ko: 립스컴 대학교 총장인 랜디 라우리의 서신을 통해

translation.en: and speaks to her 4.0 grade point average.
And then many letters from people in the community,
translation.ko: 그 지역의 많은 사람이 쓴 서신도 첨부했어요

translation.en: from the mayor, from the juvenile judge, from advocacy groups
translation.ko: 시장, 소년법원 판사 그리고 변호 단체 사람들이

translation.en: who say, you know, she's the perfect person to be considered for... for clemency.
translation.ko: 신토이아가 사면 대상으로 매우 적합하다는 편지를 써줬죠

translation.en: Dr. Bernet, he said,
"Recently, I was contacted by Ms. Brown's current attorney
translation.ko: '최근에 브라운 씨의 현 변호인이 연락을 해왔고'

translation.en: who requested my support in Ms. Brown's application for clemency."
translation.ko: '브라운 씨의 사면 신청을 지지해 줄 것을 요청했습니다'

translation.en: [Bernet] Thirteen years had elapsed between my meetings with Cyntoia.
I originally evaluated her when she was 16,
and then I saw her a few months ago when she was 29.
translation.ko: 몇 달 전에 만났을 땐 29살이 되어있었죠

translation.en: I think the most general description is that she had grown up,
translation.ko: 가장 일반적인 묘사라고 한다면 신토이아가 성숙해진 거죠

translation.en: both intellectually and socially.
I think another general impression was that she had learned a lot.
translation.ko: 또 다른 일반적인 인상이라면 많이 배웠다는 거였어요

translation.en: She had a broader understanding, I think, of life and society,
translation.ko: 삶과 사회에 관해 더 폭넓게 이해하고 있었고 "수강 과목: 전문 연구 학사"

translation.en: that she was studying interesting things in college.
She herself had gotten interested in the problem of sexual trafficking.
When I interviewed her, she was in the process of writing a term paper...
translation.ko: 제가 면담할 당시 그 주제로 학기 말 리포트를

translation.en: on that topic.
She managed to share through her own experience
and through things she had read and studied on this topic.
translation.ko: 해당 주제로 읽은 것들 연구한 것들을 담았죠 "#찬란프로젝트 '거부'를 새 규범으로"

translation.en: And she had a lot of really good ideas
for how to use that knowledge outside of the prison.
translation.ko: 어떻게 적용할지에 관해 좋은 아이디어가 많았어요

translation.en: [Gordon] Pardon and Parole Board...
they've made the decision to hear Cyntoia on her request for commutation.
translation.ko: 신토이아의 감형 신청에 대한 심리를 열기로 결정했어요

translation.en: The governor has the absolute constitutional right
to grant relief on commutation.
But before he will take any action,
he wants the opinion of the Pardon and Parole Board.
translation.ko: 사면 및 가석방 위원회의 의견을 요청한 거죠

translation.en: And that's what we're going to do this next week.
The purpose of which is to show that Cyntoia Brown has been rehabilitated
translation.ko: 우리의 목표는 신토이아가 교도소에 수감된 이후로

translation.en: since her incarceration
and that she can be a useful member of society
translation.ko: 사회에 이바지하는 일원이 될 수 있음을 보여주는 겁니다

translation.en: and, in all likelihood, will be if she receives a commuted sentence.
In 2004, she was considered to be a prostitute
even though she was 16 years old.
That has changed.
If it happened today, she would not be considered a crime
translation.ko: 지금 그 일이 벌어졌다면 신토이아는 범죄자가 아니라

translation.en: but a victim of sexual predators.
We are requesting the Pardon and Parole Board
to recommend to the governor
that he commute her sentence to second-degree murder.
translation.ko: 감형해 줄 것을 권유해 주길 요청할 겁니다

translation.en: If he does that, then that would make her eligible for parole.
translation.ko: 그렇게 되면 신토이아는 가석방을 받을 자격이 되죠

translation.en: She will still have a criminal record.
She will still lose a lot of the rights that ordinary citizens have...
translation.ko: 평범한 시민이 가진 많은 권리는 여전히 잃겠지만

translation.en: but she will have an opportunity
to live a useful and productive life outside of the prison system.
translation.ko: 유용하고 생산적인 삶을 살 기회를 얻을 거예요

translation.en: [man 1] Today is May the 23rd, 2018.
We are conducting an executive clemency hearing at Tennessee Prison for Women.
translation.ko: 테네시주 여성 교도소에서 주지사 사면 심리를 진행합니다

translation.en: This will be a commutation hearing for Cyntoia Denise Brown.
translation.ko: 이는 신토이아 데니즈 브라운의 감형 심리입니다

translation.en: Tennessee Code annotated 40-28-125A
authorizes the board to advise and make recommendations to the governor
translation.ko: 본 위원회가 주지사에게 사면, 면죄, 감형에 대하여

translation.en: in respect to pardons,
exonerations and commutations.
translation.ko: 권고 및 권유할 권한을 부여합니다 "리처드 몽고메리 위원장 테네시주 가석방 위원회"

translation.en: The governor has said he will use his clemency powers very sparingly.
translation.ko: 주지사는 자신의 사면 권한을 삼가서 행사하겠다고 했습니다

translation.en: Ms. Brown, you will be permitted to speak and to present witnesses on your behalf.
translation.ko: 브라운 씨, 본 심리에서 발언과 증인 제시를 할 수 있습니다

translation.en: At this time, I'd like to allow your counsel, Mr. Bone,
to give an opening statement, and then, Ms. Brown,
translation.ko: 모두 진술을 들은 뒤에 브라운 씨가

translation.en: we would like to hear from you in your own words
translation.ko: 브라운 씨의 말로 말씀해 주시길 바랍니다

translation.en: about why you feel that you are rehabilitated
and no longer a risk to safety of the public.
So with that, Mr. Bone?
[Bone] This is a story of transformation
in the life of a wasted child who has become
a beautiful, intelligent, caring, educated woman
translation.ko: 아름답고 총명하며 배려하는 교양 있는 여성이 되었습니다

translation.en: who can make things better in this world, and that's why we're here.
translation.ko: 이 여성은 세상에 기여할 인재며 그래서 우리가 모인 것입니다

translation.en: [Cyntoia] I just wanted to say thank you, first.
I know a lot of people get to see you, but I have prayed for a very long time...
translation.ko: 많은 사람을 만나시겠지만 전 아주 오랫동안 여러분을

translation.en: to be able to meet with you.
And I know it's purely an act of mercy that you even give me a hearing,
translation.ko: 순수히 자비의 미덕으로 이 심리를 열어주신 걸 알기에

translation.en: and that means everything to me.
What I did was horrible.
I killed Johnny Allen, and he's gone. And it stayed with me this whole time.
translation.ko: 전 조니 앨런을 죽였고 지금까지 그 일을 안고 살았습니다

translation.en: I was locked up at 16. It was like that was it.
I have no choice but to live a different life,
translation.ko: 전 어쩔 수 없이 다른 삶을 살아야 했고

translation.en: and they've given me that opportunity.
translation.ko: 그 삶을 살 기회를 얻은 것이죠

translation.en: They've given me that chance.
You know, I can't make up for what I did,
translation.ko: 제가 저지른 일을 만회할 순 없지만

translation.en: but they've given me a chance to do so much more.
translation.ko: 훨씬 많은 일을 할 기회를 얻을 수 있었습니다

translation.en: Whatever you decide, I respect it, but...
I do pray that you show me mercy and that you give me a second chance.
translation.ko: 제게 삶의 두 번째 기회를 주시기를 원합니다

translation.en: [man 2] In 2008, I was working as a prosecutor in the Tennessee Attorney General's Office,
translation.ko: 2008년에 전 테네시주 법무부 사무소에서 검사로 일했었고

translation.en: and the case of Cyntoia Denise Brown was assigned to me.
translation.ko: 신토이아 데니즈 브라운 사건이 제게 배정됐습니다

translation.en: And so it was my job to represent the state in her appeal.
translation.ko: "프레스턴 십, 전 항소심 검사 테네시주 법무부 사무소" 항소심에서 검찰을 대변하는 게 제 일이었죠

translation.en: I read every page of the trial transcript, and I examined every exhibit.
translation.ko: 전 공판 기록을 모두 읽었고 모든 증거를 검토했으며

translation.en: And I argued that she needed to spend the rest of her life in prison.
translation.ko: 피고인이 평생을 감옥에서 보내야 한다고 주장했습니다

translation.en: Cyntoia, I met her in the spring of 2009.
I just went blindly into the class not knowing who she was
translation.ko: 신토이아가 누군지 모른 채 수업하러 교실로 들어갔고

translation.en: and didn't know who she was for weeks
until, one day, I got a court opinion in the mail.
translation.ko: 어느 날 우편으로 법정 의견서를 받았어요

translation.en: I open the envelope, see what it is,
and there's Cyntoia's name on it, Cyntoia Denise Brown.
translation.ko: 신토이아의 이름이 있었죠 신토이아 데니즈 브라운요

translation.en: And that was the first time that I figured out
the Cyntoia Denise Brown whose appeal I had worked on
translation.ko: 제가 맡았던 항소심의 신토이아 데니즈 브라운이

translation.en: was the same Cyntoia Brown who was this luminous student in my class.
translation.ko: 제 수업에 나오는 총명한 학생 신토이아 브라운이라는 걸요

translation.en: She got her copy of the opinion the next day or a couple of days later.
translation.ko: 그다음 날인가 며칠 뒤에 신토이아도 의견서 사본을 받았고

translation.en: She came to class the following Wednesday night,
translation.ko: 그다음 수요일 밤 수업에 신토이아가 나와

translation.en: and we briefly talked about it.
I told her that I was sorry.
She said, "You were doing your job."
I could tell that she was hurt
because, on top of being disappointed that her appeal just got denied...
translation.ko: 얼마 전에 항소가 기각돼 실망이 큰 데다

translation.en: now she has to go through the rest of the semester
translation.ko: 남은 학기 동안 자길 가르칠 선생이

translation.en: with the guy who argued, "Yeah, 51 years is exactly right."
Justice is not just about saying,
"What crime was committed, and how much time does this person get."
translation.ko: 어떤 범죄를 저질렀고 피고인의 형량이 얼마인가요

translation.en: And having cultivated some understanding about the context in which
translation.ko: 신토이아나 많은 이들이 범죄를 저지르게 된

translation.en: her crime occurred, but a lot of people's crimes occur,
I think justice is more about trying to achieve the right outcome
translation.ko: 정의는 올바른 결과를 얻어내는 거란 생각이 들어요

translation.en: than it is about alleging rule violations.
translation.ko: 단지 법 위반을 꼬집는 게 아니라요

translation.en: Time and proximity are funny things
because they can change adversaries into allies.
translation.ko: 그 두 가지가 적을 동지로 바꾸기도 하니까요

translation.en: Here I am ten years later...
not arguing against her but arguing in favor of her release.
translation.ko: 신토이아에 대한 반론이 아닌 변론을 하고 있습니다

translation.en: And I do that because I have borne witness along with all these other folks
translation.ko: 그 이유는 여기 다른 분들처럼 신토이아가 어떤 사람인지를

translation.en: to the kind of person that Cyntoia is.
[Sinback] Ladies and gentlemen of the board, I am honored to come before you today
translation.ko: 위원회 여러분, 오늘 이렇게 여러분을 뵙게 되어 영광입니다

translation.en: as Cyntoia Brown's juvenile court attorney and friend of 14 years.
translation.ko: 전 신토이아의 소년 법정 변호인이자 14년 지기 친구입니다

translation.en: I would like to tell you only about the Cyntoia Brown of today,
translation.ko: 지금까지 많이 들으신 놀라운 여성, 신토이아 브라운의

translation.en: the remarkable woman you've been hearing so much about,
but I would be remiss if I did not also tell you
about the Cyntoia Brown I met on August 9th, 2004,
three days after the horrible incident that caused her to be in here.
translation.ko: 신토이아를 이곳에 오게 한 끔찍한 사건이 있은 지 3일 뒤죠

translation.en: When I represented Cyntoia when she was 16 at the transfer hearing,
translation.ko: 제가 신토이아의 이송 심리에서 16살인 신토이아를 변호할 때

translation.en: my goal was to really show who Cyntoia was.
translation.ko: 제 목표는 신토이아가 누군지 보여주는 거였어요

translation.en: She had been through a lot of really hard things in her life.
translation.ko: 살면서 너무도 힘든 일을 많이 겪은 아이였죠

translation.en: What really brought it full circle for me
was when I became involved in the case again,
working with Cyntoia and working on her clemency.
translation.ko: 신토이아와 다시 만나고 사면 신청을 돕고 있으니까요

translation.en: I realized that I was really using the same strategy
translation.ko: 생각해 보니 제가 이송 심리 때 쓴 전략을

translation.en: that I had used during the transfer hearing
to really show that she's a person who can be in the community
translation.ko: 즉, 신토이아가 사회에 도움이 될 만한 사람이고

translation.en: and that she deserves to have a chance to live a life.
translation.ko: 자기 삶을 살 기회를 얻을 자격이 있다는 거요

translation.en: When I was a defense attorney,
it always was very interesting when people would ask me,
translation.ko: 늘 흥미로웠던 게 사람들이 이런 걸 물을 때였죠

translation.en: "Why fight for someone like that?
Why fight for a person who has taken a life?
translation.ko: '다른 생명을 앗아간 사람을 왜 변호해 줘요?'

translation.en: How can you defend that person who's guilty?
translation.ko: '유죄인 사람을 어떻게 변호해 줄 수 있죠?'

translation.en: What if they get out and do the same thing again?"
translation.ko: '그 사람이 나와서 똑같은 짓을 또 하면요?'

translation.en: -Hi, guys. -[students] Hi.
-How you doing? Good to see you today. -[students] Good.
Um, so we've been talking about juvenile transfer and the situation that you all are in.
translation.ko: 그동안 미성년자 이송과 여러분의 상황에 대해 얘기했죠

translation.en: Cyntoia's case fits into the issue of sentencing reform
translation.ko: 신토이아의 사건은 처벌 개혁 논란에 부합해요

translation.en: by showing us that children deserve a review,
translation.ko: 아이에겐 재고의 기회를 가질 자격이 있음을 보여주죠

translation.en: not necessarily parole or release,
but that all children deserve us to take a look at them
translation.ko: 모든 아이는 상당한 시간이 흐른 뒤에 다시 한번

translation.en: after a fair number of years.
The community is ready to welcome Cyntoia into its fold and to see her face-to-face,
translation.ko: 사회는 신토이아를 반겨주고 정면으로 맞이할 준비가 됐습니다

translation.en: not as the child she was in 2004,
but as the incredible, incredible woman that she has become.
Thank you.
[Montgomery] What I would like to do now is go to the victim's side.
translation.ko: 이제 피해자 측 얘기를 들어보고자 합니다

translation.en: Just tell me your name, if you would please,
and make any comment you'd like to make.
[woman 1] My name is Anna Whaley.
I'm a close personal friend of Johnny
and his family.
Johnny has a voice, and Johnny's family has a voice.
translation.ko: "애나 웨일리, 조니 앨런의 친구" 조니와 조니의 가족에겐 목소리가 있습니다

translation.en: It's not been heard in all these years, but today I am that voice.
translation.ko: 지금껏 그 목소리가 묻혀왔으나 오늘은 제가 대신하려 합니다

translation.en: Cyntoia has done great harm...
and Johnny did not deserve to die.
I hope...
I hope sincerely God has transformed her life.
I do.
Johnny's life mattered.
Johnny was loved, and he is missed dearly. And this is a very sad story.
translation.ko: 우린 사랑했던 조니를 잃었고 이는 매우 슬픈 이야기입니다

translation.en: Thank you.
[Montgomery] I am ready to vote.
I'm going to agree to the commutation of second-degree murder.
[woman 2] My recommendation to the governor will be
to recommend changing Defendant Brown's parole eligibility date
translation.ko: 피고인 브라운의 가석방 심사 가능 날짜를

translation.en: to August of 2029, in other words, after serving 25 years.
My recommendation to the governor will be to decline your application.
translation.ko: 주지사에게 전할 제 권고는 사면 신청 거부입니다

translation.en: [Montgomery] So you have heard all of the different recommendations
that will be going to the governor.
We will do a report. He will decide what he will do.
translation.ko: 저희가 보고서를 제출할 거고 주지사가 결정을 내리죠

translation.en: As we said earlier, this is a recommendation to him.
-He makes the final decision. -Thank you.
[Bone] We end up with a divided group in terms of the decision that they made.
translation.ko: 가석방 위원회가 내린 결정에선 찬반이 나뉘었어요

translation.en: Two who thought to lower the sentence from first-degree to second-degree
and two who thought her term should be lowered to 25 years.
And then two who thought there should be no relief.
translation.ko: 나머지 둘은 구제해선 안 된다고 했죠

translation.en: We don't know.
So we'll see what the governor says.
[Brown] How things have changed for me the last 14 years?
There has been times that, you know, I really wanted to give up.
translation.ko: 때로 너무 포기하고 싶은 순간들이 있었죠

translation.en: I allowed myself to get in that place of despair.
translation.ko: 절망으로 가득 찬 시기에 빠지기도 했어요

translation.en: But through it all, I feel that I have persevered
translation.ko: 하지만 그 힘든 시기를 잘 버텼다고 생각해요

translation.en: because the one constant
that has always been in Cyntoia's life has been me.
translation.ko: 신토이아의 삶에 언제나 함께한 사람이 저였으니까요

translation.en: And I know, if I allow myself to fall apart,
then who does she have?
Where are her hopes and where are her dreams?
translation.ko: 그 애의 꿈과 희망이 어디에 있겠어요?

translation.en: The emotional roller coaster that I've been on is...
like nothing that you ever experienced.
Because, at this point now, I don't allow myself to hope.
I want to and I do hope that, in the end, everything is gonna be
translation.ko: 물론 원하고 희망하죠 결국에는 이 모든 게

translation.en: the way I pray for it to be, and that's to have her home.
translation.ko: 기도한 대로 이루어져 신토이아가 집으로 오기를요

translation.en: And I'm thinking...
...it's gonna happen this time.
It's gonna happen.
And then it doesn't happen.
Going to see Cyntoia is... [laughs] ...pretty routine for me.
translation.ko: 신토이아를 보러 가는 게 거의 일상이 됐어요

translation.en: I think the biggest change that I've seen in... in Toia
translation.ko: 이 도로를 수없이 다니면서 토이아에게서 본

translation.en: since I've been making this drive down here is...
She's more open.
You know, for a very long time, she couldn't really
or didn't really express truly how she felt about things.
We still don't know the outcome, but now we can honestly say there is hope.
translation.ko: 아직 결과는 모르지만 희망이 있다고 말할 수 있어요

translation.en: People know what has happened in this state, and people are watching.
translation.ko: 사람들이 이 주에서 일어난 일을 알고 주시하고 있죠

translation.en: If he says yes, Toia can walk out a free woman.
translation.ko: 주지사가 승인하면 토이아는 자유롭게 풀려날 거고

translation.en: It's gonna hurt us all if he says no.
translation.ko: 주지사가 거부하면 우리 모두 상심할 거예요

translation.en: We're leaving the office now.
We're going to try to communicate to Cyntoia
the decision that the governor has made.
[woman, over phone] Do you know what building we're going in?
Yeah, we're going in where we've always gone in.
[Sinback, over phone] The visitation building?
[Bone] The governor's lawyer, Dwight Tarwater, called
and said, "We want y'all to come meet with us tomorrow morning,
translation.ko: 내일 오전에 우리와 만났으면 한다고 말했어요

translation.en: but you can't tell anybody.
This is a strictly private meeting."
We went in to see Dwight,
and he says, "Hold on a minute. Let me go see if the governor's ready."
We didn't have any idea we were gonna meet with the governor.
Can you imagine holding your breath for minutes while you're waiting?
translation.ko: 기다리는 몇 분 동안 긴장감에 숨도 못 쉬겠더라고요

translation.en: And the governor said, "I want to tell you what we're gonna do."
translation.ko: 주지사는 앞으로 어떻게 할지 말해주겠다고 했죠

translation.en: The governor is gonna commute her sentence to 15 years.
And that'll end in August.
She's gonna move to the transition group for the next seven months,
translation.ko: 그 전에 7개월 동안 사회 적응 그룹에 있을 거고

translation.en: and she's gonna be on probation for ten years.
translation.ko: 출소 후 10년간 보호 관찰을 받을 겁니다

translation.en: We walked in. I got the first hug, and I said,
"You're getting out in August," because I wanted it to just be.
-You know, I didn't want any suspense. -[line ringing]
So, you know, she started dancing.
She just couldn't have been more excited, and it was just perfect, just perfect.
translation.ko: 그 소식에 정말 기뻐했고 그냥 다 완벽했어

translation.en: So she's really, really happy, so--
-[woman, over phone] Did she cry? -Did she cry?
translation.ko: 울던가요? "전화상: 카멜리나 에커먼 찰스 본의 보조원"

translation.en: -Yeah. -[Eckerman] Yeah. -Yeah. Yeah, everybody cried. -[Eckerman] Oh! [gasps]
-Oh, hallelujah! -Yeah, yeah, yeah.
I told her also to try to call a little after 11:00,
and we might even be able to put her on the speakerphone someplace.
translation.ko: 어딘가에 스피커폰으로 연결할 수 있을 거야

translation.en: You ready? Okay. I'm gonna put you on speakerphone, okay?
We have a really large group, and... but we wanted you to be able to say hello
translation.ko: 아주 많은 사람이 모였어 네가 직접 인사하고

translation.en: and thank you to the people who are here
and the people who've been praying for you all these years
-and so interested in your life. -[Cyntoia, over phone] Yes.
[Bone] I'm not gonna try to tell you the people who are here,
translation.ko: 여기 누가 있는지 일일이 호명하지 않아도

translation.en: but you can guess.
[Cyntoia] Oh, I love y'all.
-[woman] We love you! -We love you too.
[Cyntoia] You said, as soon as I come to God,
translation.ko: 여러분이 그러셨죠 제가 주님께 다가가는 순간

translation.en: that He was gonna release me. You said it.
translation.ko: 주님이 절 풀어주실 거라고 여러분이 그러셨어요

translation.en: It is the culmination of 15 years
of hard work and tears and anguish and joy.
She has everything that she needs, you know, to be successful.
translation.ko: 신토이아는 성공에 필요한 모든 걸 갖췄어요

translation.en: How she uses it...
will be basically up to her.
Where the roads lead, I don't know, but you know what?
I hope they lead to a rainbow for her.
[Cyntoia] I have come such a long way. It's been a very long time.
translation.ko: 아주 먼 길을 걸어왔습니다 오랜 시간이 걸렸어요

translation.en: When I was 16, I did a horrible thing.
And I have carried that with me this whole time.
I understand the things that I've done.
That it was so necessary to change.
Everybody who's been here for me,
I would not be here if it weren't for them.
Through everything that's been shown today, I'm not gonna let you down.
translation.ko: 오늘 여러분께 보여드렸듯이 절대 실망시키지 않겠습니다

translation.en: I have a whole new family, a whole new community
of people who love me, who believe in me, who support me.
translation.ko: 절 사랑해 주고 믿어주며 지지를 보내주고 있습니다

translation.en: There's so many things that I understand now that I didn't know.
translation.ko: 제가 몰랐던 많은 부분을 이제는 이해하지만

translation.en: There's so many young people that still don't know,
translation.ko: 아직 모르고 있는 수많은 어린 친구들에게

translation.en: and I feel called to share that.
I don't take that lightly.
And I can assure you that I will not let you down.
I promise.
